Posts.Content: marygrace2 wrote: hi all, I have a lump in my left breast which i am going to have removed the 27th of february. For the past 3 days my underarm on the same side of my lump is killing me ...very tender i dont feel any lumps but very sore even when i move my arm. I cant even sleep on my left side from the pain. could this have something to do with my lump? I have been very worried the last couple of days. I was on a drug called imuran(it supresses the imune system) for about 2 years and the research i have been doing it is a carcinagen. Mostly causes lymphoma. So now i am freaking out about that. My gland over my collar bone seems larger on the left side. when i pointed this out to the surgeon he said it appeared to be in normal limits whatever that means. When they remove this lump can they tell right away by looking at it if it is cancer? I explained to my surgeon that i was on imuran but he said that was a couple of years ago. what it says about this drug is it takes your whole imune system away and if there are any funky cells they have an oppt. to grow. they may not get large enough to be noticed until years after you are off the drug... I guess just freaking out a little, I think i could deal with BC but i dont think i could take finding out i have lymphoma... Any thoughts!!! mary-grace Log in to post a reply
